resources.string: A function can not be defined inside another function.
Functions can not return more than one value at a time
Functions can be called either by value or reference.
If return type for a function is not specified it defaults to int.
A function may have any number of return statements each returning different values.
Maximum number of arguments that a function can take is 12.
Usually recursion works slower than loops.
Are the expression *ptr++ and ++*ptr are same
Modulus operator cannot be used with a long double.
A short integer is atleast 16 bits wide and a long integer is atleast 32 bits wide.
A char variable can store either an ASCII character or a Unicode character.
A union cannot be nested in a structure.
It is not possible to create an array of pointer to structures.
